com.qtplaf.library.trading.server

Interface OrderManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DkOrderManager

    public interface OrderManager
    Interface responsible to manage orders.
    Author:
    Miquel Sas

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getOrderById

        Order getOrderById(java.lang.String id)
            throws ServerException
        Returns an order identified by the id.
        Parameters:
        id - The identifier.
        Returns:
        The order if not an error occurs.
        Throws:
        ServerException - If a server error occurs.

               throws ServerException
        Returns an order identified by the label.
        Parameters:
        label - The label.
        Returns:
        The order if not an error occurs.
        Throws:
        ServerException - If a server error occurs.

      • getOrders

        java.util.List<Order> getOrders()
                         throws ServerException
        Returns a list with all currently active orders.
        Returns:
        The list of orders.
        Throws:
        ServerException - If a server error occurs.

      • getOrders

        java.util.List<Order> getOrders(Instrument instrument)
                         throws ServerException
        Returns a list with all currently active orders for the given instrument.
        Parameters:
        instrument - The instrument to check.
        Returns:
        The list of orders.
        Throws:
        ServerException - If a server error occurs.

      • submitOrder

        Order submitOrder(java.lang.String label,
                  Instrument instrument,
                  OrderCommand orderCommand,
                  double amount)
           throws ServerException
        Submits a request for an order at market price.
        Parameters:
        label - The order label. It is recommended to set an unique identifier as a label, since it is a way to retrieve the order, for instance once lost the identifier that the server sets.
        instrument - The instrument.
        orderCommand - The order command.
        amount - the amount.
        Returns:
        The order if succefully created.
        Throws:
        ServerException - If a server error occurs.

      • submitOrder

        Order submitOrder(java.lang.String label,
                  Instrument instrument,
                  OrderCommand orderCommand,
                  double amount,
                  double price)
           throws ServerException
        Submits a request for an order.
        Parameters:
        label - The order label. It is recommended to set an unique identifier as a label, since it is a way to retrieve the order, for instance once lost the identifier that the server sets.
        instrument - The instrument.
        orderCommand - The order command.
        amount - the amount.
        price - The required price.
        Returns:
        The order if succefully created.
        Throws:
        ServerException - If a server error occurs.

      • submitOrder

        Order submitOrder(java.lang.String label,
                  Instrument instrument,
                  OrderCommand orderCommand,
                  double amount,
                  double price,
                  double slippage)
           throws ServerException
        Submits a request for an order.
        Parameters:
        label - The order label. It is recommended to set an unique identifier as a label, since it is a way to retrieve the order, for instance once lost the identifier that the server sets.
        instrument - The instrument.
        orderCommand - The order command.
        amount - the amount.
        price - The required price.
        slippage - The accepted slippage.
        Returns:
        The order if succefully created.
        Throws:
        ServerException - If a server error occurs.

      • submitOrder

        Order submitOrder(java.lang.String label,
                  Instrument instrument,
                  OrderCommand orderCommand,
                  double amount,
                  double price,
                  double slippage,
                  double stopLossPrice)
           throws ServerException
        Submits a request for an order.
        Parameters:
        label - The order label. It is recommended to set an unique identifier as a label, since it is a way to retrieve the order, for instance once lost the identifier that the server sets.
        instrument - The instrument.
        orderCommand - The order command.
        amount - the amount.
        price - The required price.
        slippage - The accepted slippage.
        stopLossPrice - The stop loss price.
        Returns:
        The order if succefully created.
        Throws:
        ServerException - If a server error occurs.

      • submitOrder

        Order submitOrder(java.lang.String label,
                  Instrument instrument,
                  OrderCommand orderCommand,
                  double amount,
                  double price,
                  double slippage,
                  double stopLossPrice,
                  double takeProfitPrice)
           throws ServerException
        Submits a request for an order.
        Parameters:
        label - The order label. It is recommended to set an unique identifier as a label, since it is a way to retrieve the order, for instance once lost the identifier that the server sets.
        instrument - The instrument.
        orderCommand - The order command.
        amount - the amount.
        price - The required price.
        slippage - The accepted slippage.
        stopLossPrice - The stop loss price.
        takeProfitPrice - The take profit price.
        Returns:
        The order if succefully created.
        Throws:
        ServerException - If a server error occurs.

      • submitOrder

        Order submitOrder(java.lang.String label,
                  Instrument instrument,
                  OrderCommand orderCommand,
                  double amount,
                  double price,
                  double slippage,
                  double stopLossPrice,
                  double takeProfitPrice,
                  long expirationTime)
           throws ServerException
        Submits a request for an order with full parameters, except the comment.
        Parameters:
        label - The order label. It is recommended to set an unique identifier as a label, since it is a way to retrieve the order, for instance once lost the identifier that the server sets.
        instrument - The instrument.
        orderCommand - The order command.
        amount - the amount.
        price - The required price.
        slippage - The accepted slippage.
        stopLossPrice - The stop loss price.
        takeProfitPrice - The take profit price.
        expirationTime - A long indicating how long the order should be alive if not executed. For market orders must be zero.
        Returns:
        The order if succefully created.
        Throws:
        ServerException - If a server error occurs.

      • submitOrder

        Order submitOrder(java.lang.String label,
                  Instrument instrument,
                  OrderCommand orderCommand,
                  double amount,
                  double price,
                  double slippage,
                  double stopLossPrice,
                  double takeProfitPrice,
                  long expirationTime,
                  java.lang.String comment)
           throws ServerException
        Submits a request for an order with full parameters.
        Parameters:
        label - The order label. It is recommended to set an unique identifier as a label, since it is a way to retrieve the order, for instance once lost the identifier that the server sets.
        instrument - The instrument.
        orderCommand - The order command.
        amount - the amount.
        price - The required price.
        slippage - The accepted slippage.
        stopLossPrice - The stop loss price.
        takeProfitPrice - The take profit price.
        expirationTime - A long indicating how long the order should be alive if not executed. For market orders must be zero.
        comment - An optional comment.
        Returns:
        The order if succefully created.
        Throws:
        ServerException - If a server error occurs.
